message_1: A metal rod of length 10 cm and radius 5 cm is initially at a uniform temperature of 100 degrees Celsius. At time t=0, the rod is placed in a surrounding medium at a temperature of 0 degrees Celsius. Given the thermal diffusivity of the metal as 0.01 cm^2/sec and the specific heat capacity as 0.1 J/(g*K), find the temperature distribution in the rod as a function of time t, at a distance r from the center of the rod. Also, determine the time taken for the center of the rod to reach a temperature of 50 degrees Celsius.

where T_initial is the initial temperature (100 degrees Celsius), T_surrounding is the surrounding temperature (0 degrees Celsius), alpha is the thermal diffusivity (0.01 cm^2/sec), L is the length of the rod (10 cm), and J0 is the zeroth-order Bessel function of the first kind.
